Evening Movement Chart

A horn at nineteen hundred. Porch lights blink in sequence. Choir trios, baton acts, and jump-rope duets report to the tiled edge while bakery couriers lace layers with cardamom cream. Dispatch begins when the water line reaches the brass notch.

18:40 - curtain pins inspected
19:00 - first ladle salute
19:20 - cake convoy exits washroom bay
20:05 - medals and torte allotment

Tonight's reserve wagon carries almond sponge, pear jam, and two extra ribbons for first-time soloists.

Tubside Command Notice

All acts are marshaled by a seated quartermaster from Bath Unit No. 3. Towels remain folded by rank. No confetti below drain grade.

Weather adaptation: If drizzle begins, stage is relocated to the garage lintel, cakes remain under wax cloth.

Program Rates
